The only disappointment was the fee for my dogs. I don't think a hotel should charge a per night, per dog fee. I was impressed that the owner also worked the hotel. Thank you staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: azrailer
Reviews.Content: After reviewing this hotel on trip advisor we called the hotel to reserve a room. The staff at this hotel is one of the best we have had the pleasure of dealing with in our many years of travel. At check in they gave us tips on what to see, where to eat based on there personal experience and how to get there. The "L" Orange line station is only 2 blocks away and they shuttled us there and back many times during our 4 day stay. You can get to almost anywhere from the light rail combined with a short taxi ride if neccesary.They also shuttled us to Midway Airport when it was time to leave. The room was clean and comfortable and although we were told the airport noise might bother us we really didn't notice. They have a small but sufficient continental breakfast complete with sausage and egg bagels from Dunkin Donuts.This is not a 5 star downtown resort but the staff here goes the extra mile to make there guests feel welcome and provides the best service anyone could ask for. Thanks to them our stay in Chicago was all we could have asked for. We highly recomend this hotel to anyone who does not want to stay in downtown at a 3 to 5 hundred dollar a night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET, SAFE, CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghTripper
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I had been at a B&B and were disappointed. We wanted something near Midway where we could tour the city and then come back relax, have some popcorn and watch TV. We wanted to "hunker" down for the night and wake up early. The motel is nothing fancy but it sure is CLEAN and quiet with a nice table for reading the newspaper, etc. The staff is VERY helpful. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: MAJx4
Reviews.Content: Even before I got to my room, I'd already experienced a warm connection to the Charlton Inn Midway staff. The shuttle came to the airport quickly and the driver was friendly. The reception I received from the check-in staff was courteous and they spent a generous amount of time showing me how to use the public rail-system to get downtown and gave me information on many sights to see. The room itself was clean, updated and spacious. The continental breakfast was filling. This was my first trip to Chicago and, although it was too brief, whether I return alone or with family, I already know I'll be staying at the Charlton. My thanks to everyone for making my stay so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: UtahLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: If you don't need the luxury of a higher priced place to stay, and you want a convenient location with a very helpful staff, this is a good choice. Bathroom facility could be better...like at least a shelf for toiletries; and the only cleansers provided were the gel and shampoo... in the shower. Towels could double as exfoliators! And the telephone was across from the foot of the bed. The Internet was very slow. But we didn't mind as everything else compensated. The staff even offered to drive us to a movie theater 8 miles away!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: kdoyle26
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel because the staff is so friendly and accommodating. They are willing to drive you the subway station or bus stop and they were helpful giving feedback on places to go. Place was clean, safe and comfortable. I recommend this to anyone looking for good neighborhood service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel033
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and nice place to stay. Staff went way out of their way to accommodate us when we left our bag at the hotel. I plan on staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: soljerblue
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at Carlton Inn Midway on two successive Chicago tripsover two summers, and would recommend it to anyone, anytime. Its convenience to Midway Airport and the CTA system are good points. The good restaurants close by, especially Pindos, are also pluses, as well as the neighborhood "feel" of the area. But far and away, the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms, the courtesy and friendliness of the entire staff, and the reasonable rates put it on top of my list for any trip to the Windy City. You can pick any "name" hotel where you'll pay a lot more, but you won't find a better "deal" or finer people than right here. Steve Ross Birmingham, AL

Reviews.Title: “A nice, economical place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Visitor007
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion and celebrated a birthday while at the Carlton Inn Midway in Chicago. The hotel was nice, clean, convenient, accomodating, and knowlegeable about sites to see and how to use the public transportation. The shuttle service was ABSOLUTELY perfect. A nice and affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Amadorcounty
Reviews.Content: The entire staff (including the two great in resident dogs) were very nice and helpful telling us about great restaurants in area and in downtown Chicago. Nice having a shuttle take us to the airport right when we wanted. Enjoyed having a microwave and refrigerator in our room too. Also liked that the Orange L train was only a couple of blocks away - easy walk. They even did our airline boarding passes for us.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: DE_Jobie
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hospitality of the hotel staff. They were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Their shuttle took us to and from the airport. Their shuttle even took us to and from the train station even though it was within walking distance from the hotel. They were very helpful with explaining the transit system and transit fare cards to us. Our room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast of Dunkin' Donuts bagels, donuts and breakfast sandwiches was awesome, especially after a stay at a Radisson that provided no free breakfast items. I would definitely recommend staying here. There are several restaurants in walking distance also. We ate at Pindo's, a family style restaurant with good food, good prices and friendly staff that is only two doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location, really great staff”
Reviews.Author: mantaraggio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the Pulaski stop of the CTA and is about a 15 minute ride in to the Loop. For the price, the location is fantastic. You can park your car and just head straight into the city. The exterior looks like a standard motor lodge, but the rooms themselves are really nice and beautifully decorated. There's a fridge, a big TV with DVR capability, a desk, a bed with really soft and plentiful pillows. The high speed wireless internet was slow when I stayed there, but they were working on fixing it. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast included coffee, donuts, and Dunkin Donuts egg sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “great inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: slivalisa
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very knowledgeable and able to offer information on how to get to many destinations. The room was very clean. Security was excellent. Great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in hotels”
Reviews.Author: drhowarddrfine
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago to visit colleges with my son. We stayed two nights in double beds for the AAA price of about $112/night. I was wary of this hotel because it only had two diamonds from AAA and I had stayed downtown at another two diamond hotel which was not very comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby staff were very friendly, giving helpful advice on where to eat and how to use the 'el train'. The rooms had been remodeled just four years ago and were up to date and very clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. An in-room refrigerator, microwave and free broadband internet access makes this a top choice for my future visits. You don't get that at any of the other much more expensive hotels that offer "premium service". A grocery store, and all kinds of familiar foods are within two or three blocks walking distance but most offer free delivery to the hotel. The El train is only one block away getting you downtown with ease in less than 25-minutes but it's also an easy trip back to the I-55 highway. A couple of channels on the TV were fuzzy and I brought it to their attention. I was in a room toward the back and wasn't affected by the busy street noise, though I could hear a couple of "big rigs" during the day. Overhead airplane noise from Midway was noticeable until about 11pm or so but not overnight. Apparently traffic patterns change, too, and the second night I heard none. I deducted one star for this but it did not keep me from getting a good nights sleep. The neighborhood is busy with traffic and I felt somewhat uncomfortable walking it at first, but I then realized my fears were unfounded and I think it's perfectly safe. Asking directions and questions a few times of the locals brought friendly responses. Free coffee, doughnuts and, especially, breakfast sandwiches were another pleasant surprise. My last two stays in Chicago were at the high-end Palmer House downtown. The services offered and available at this Carlton Inn give me no reason to do that anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sacral
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was so pleasant. I booked a room after reaching chicago midway airport and the staff kindly let me do it. They were very cooperative. The hotel room has all amenities in it and was very clean. I am glad I stayed at Carlton Inn Midway hotel. I would recommend it to anyone who can/wants to spend $100/night for a neat stay!

Reviews.Title: “A family trip to see King Tut.”
Reviews.Author: highwayfreak
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Chicago to see the King Tut exhibit at the Field Museum. We wanted a hotel close to the museum, but all were booked due to events occurring the week we were to arrive. We settled for The Carlton Inn Midway and are very glad we did. The place was clean and quiet. We had to arrive very late which we have found to be a problem several places we have stayed. It was not a problem at the Carlton. Although the Carlton is a ways from the museum, we found it actually very convenient. The first day we drove, it was a straight shot with no chance of getting lost. The second day we used the el, a half block walk from the hotel, which proved to be an inexpensive, rapid method of exploring the city. Our kids were thrilled. The best thing about the Carlton Inn was the staff. We were made to feel welcome. They went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. Future trips to Chicago will find us at the Carlton Inn Midway.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: Tourist_Bremen
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been visiting the RSNA meeting in Chicago every year since 1997. Last year was the fourth time I have spent a week in the Tangiers motel. It is a middle class motel with all usual facilities. It is quiet at night, non-expensive (last year the weekly rate was $40/day) and clean. You can get a good breakfast at PindoÂ´s restaurant which is only 50 mtrs away. Some shopping malls are also available within walking distance (about 1/2 Mile). With a car you can reach Chicago downtown in 15 minutes.

HotelInfo.Name: Carlton Inn Midway
HotelInfo.Address: 4944 S. Archer Avenue, Chicago, IL 60632
